@Module.Name: Predict
@Module.Description: This module is a prediction model, predicting what will appear after clicking each components on current screen

Output.<div id=1 class='' > Add account </div>\: Button to add a new account
Output.<div id=2 class='' > saltyp0rridge20@gma: Display the email address of the current account
Output.<div id=5 class='' description='Navigate: Button to navigate back to the previous page

@Module.Name: Select
@Module.Description: This module is a selection model, selecting the 5 possible component without relativity ranking to be acted on catering to user's intent
@Module.Note: This individual module only select 5 highly related components,without ranking them,and without analyzing the correctness of the components aligning with user's content

Output.<div id=1 class='' > Add account </div>\: Selected because the user may need to add an account before they can set notification preferences.
Output.<div id=2 class='' > saltyp0rridge20@gma: Selected because notification settings are typically tied to a specific email account, and this component displays the current email account.
Output.<div id=3 class='' > General settings </: Selected because this is the General Settings button where options related to notifications are likely to be found.
Output.<button id=4 class='' description='More: Selected because 'More options' could contain sub-settings where notification preferences could be altered.
Output.<div id=5 class='' description='Navigate: Selected because this is the navigate back button. Should the user enter a menu that doesn't lead to notification settings, they may want to navigate back and try another component.

@Module.Name: Plan
@Module.Description: This module is a plan module, planning the next action based on the selected components, whether click or edit

candidate1.reason: To add a new account, not relevant to turning on notifications settings.

candidate2.reason: To access the account settings, not relevant to turning on notifications settings.

candidate3.reason: To access the general settings, not relevant to turning on notifications settings.

candidate4.reason: To access more options, not relevant to turning on notifications settings.

candidate5.reason: To navigate back, not relevant to turning on notifications settings.

@Module.Name: Evaluate
@Module.Description: This module is an evaluation module, evaluating the selected components of their contribution to fulfilling the user's intent

@Module.Name: Decide
@Module.Description: This module is a decision module, deciding the final action based on the evaluation result, whether complete or wrong or go on

Output.reason: The user is on the correct path to the desired task, but hasn't yet completed the task of switching on notifications. The user is on the 'General settings' page and should next click on 'Manage notifications' to access the notifications settings.
